string-array.item: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun.
It has a highly elliptical orbit around the Sun.
Its surface is covered in craters and looks desolate.
Temperatures on Mercury vary dramatically, from extremely hot to extremely cold.
A day on Mercury lasts approximately 59 Earth days.
Despite its proximity to the Sun, Mercury is not the hottest planet due to its lack of atmosphere.
NASA s MESSENGER probe was the first to orbit Mercury.
Mercury has much weaker gravity than Earth.
The name Mercury comes from the Roman god of merchants and travelers.
